meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I bled a lot after cutting my finger.
meanings.sent2: The wound bled profusely before I managed to stop it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally bled on my white shirt while cooking spaghetti sauce.
meanings.sent4: The red paint bled into the white, creating a beautiful pink hue.
meanings.sent5: The image of the soldier's bled hand left a lasting impression on me.

meanings.definition: To lose blood from the body.
meanings.sent1: The injured soldier bled heavily on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: She felt weak as she bled from the deep cut on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The vampire bat bled the cow dry, leaving it weak and pale.
meanings.sent4: Her heart bled for the stray puppy shivering in the cold rain.
meanings.sent5: The wounded deer bled out slowly, staining the forest floor red.

meanings.definition: To have a color run or fade.
meanings.sent1: The colors on the painting bled together after being left in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The ink bled on the paper, creating a blurry effect.
meanings.sent3: The tie-dye shirt bled in the wash, turning everything pink.
meanings.sent4: The sunset bled across the sky, painting it in shades of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The dye bled from the fabric, leaving a trail of color behind.
